data.meta_site_name: Obituary for Harold Orr | January 8, 2023 | Shirley & Stout, Hasler & Stout, Stout & Son Funeral Homes
data.text:
Harold E. Orr, 87, of Kokomo, IN, died Sunday January 8, 2023, at his home. He was born January 1, 1936, in Tipton County, IN, the son of Leon and Mary K. (Shockley) Orr. He married Judith K. Achors on August 16, 1958, and she preceded him in death on April 23, 2020.

After graduating from Forest High School, Harold completed basic naval training at Great Lakes Naval Training Center in Chicago. He began his General Motors career at Delco Radio by graduating from General Motors Institute in Flint, Michigan. He worked in the tool design department. Nearly 40 years later, he retired from the C.A.D. Technology Group at Delco Electronics.

Harold was an active church member all his life in a variety of capacities. He served at West Point Christian Church in Russiaville, South Side Christian Church in Kokomo, and Burlington Church of Christ.

Harold is survived by his children, Melissa (Rick Bailey) Orr, Matthew (Deborah) Orr; brother, Mike (Pam) Orr; brother-in-law, Phil (Kathy) Smith; sisters-in-law, Beverly (Boyd) Ashcraft and Kitty Achors; grandchildren, Kayla (Chris) Johnson, Kody (Sy Howard) Orr; step-grandchildren, Nicholas Underhill, Nicole Underhill; great-grandchildren, Landen Musson, Kennedy Musson, Brighton Musson; great-grandchild on the way, Denver Johnson; step-great-grandson, Dayton Shepard; several nieces, nephews, and cousins.

He was preceded in death by his parents, Leon and Mary K. Orr; wife, Judith Orr; sister, Wanda K. Smith; brother-in-law, Kent Achors; sister-in-law, Janae Achors; step-grandchild, Joseph Underhill: and father and mother-in-law, Herman & Marie Achors.

Friends are invited to visit with the family from 10 am to Noon on Friday January 13, 2023, at Stout & Son Funeral Home, 200 East Main Street, Russiaville, IN 46979. Funeral service will begin at Noon on Friday at the funeral home, with Pastor Darren Mirracle officiating. Entombment will follow in Sunset Memory Garden. In lieu of flowers, contributions may be made in Haroldâ€™s memory to West Point Christian Church. Messages of condolence may be left online at www.stoutandson.com.
